<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>If you're feeling bummed about being stuck at home for the foreseeable future, remember that Shakespeare wrote <em>King Lear </em>when the plague closed theaters. You too can contribute something of similar value to humankind. </p>

<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Economy: </strong></span><span>“Not since the attacks of Sept. 11, 2001, has a crisis enveloped so much of the economy so quickly,” </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/15/business/economy/coronavirus-economy-impact.html?referringSource=articleShare&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes the NYT</a></span><span>. Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin said he’s </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-15/mnuchin-says-doesn-t-expect-u-s-recession-from-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not anticipating a recession</a></span><span>, but “because of the things that we’re requesting to do, there are parts of the economy shutting down or slowing down dramatically.”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Markets: </strong></span><span>Stock futures </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/15/traders-await-futures-open-after-fed-cuts-rates-launches-easing-program.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">plummeted</a></span><span> to their "limit down" levels despite coordinated action from central banks around the world. Extreme volatility is going nowhere. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">2020:</strong></span><span> With podiums a safe social distance apart, Democratic candidates Bernie Sanders and Joe Biden </span><span><a href="https://nymag.com/intelligencer/2020/03/live-updates-from-the-bernie-biden-debate.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">debated</a></span><span> how to respond to the coronavirus pandemic, the chances of a recession, and their handwashing techniques.</span>
</li>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/15/weekend-world-declared-war-coronavirus?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A World at War
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A sign telling people to stay at home" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTkvc3RheV9hdF9ob21lX3BpYy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>David Ramos/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This weekend, the world declared war on the coronavirus. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Federal Reserve took drastic emergency action yesterday to stabilize the economy. It <a href="https://apnews.com/cf1d8e5487eee5e9eb649f0c6700ded6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cut interest rates</a> by a full percentage point and said it would buy $700 billion in Treasuries and mortgage-backed securities. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Businesses facing a sudden drop in customers need short-term loans to keep the lights on and pay employees. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"All told, the Fed's aggressive actions are intended to keep financial markets functioning and lending flowing to businesses and consumers," the AP explains. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The private sector mobilizes </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">During World War II, Chrysler and GM began making fuselages, airplane engines, and tanks. Today, companies are also ditching their day-to-day to serve the greater need.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">LVMH, </strong>the French luxury group, is <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/15/lvmh-converts-perfume-facilities-france-disinfectant-production?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">converting</a> facilities that typically produce cosmetics and perfumes for brands like Christian Dior to make disinfectant gel and prevent a shortage of hand sanitizer.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The U.K. </strong>is <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/business-51896168?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">talking to </a>Rolls-Royce, manufacturer JCB, and other firms to help make ventilators. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Consumer goods companies </strong>are <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-retail-usa/factories-shift-operations-in-scramble-to-restock-supermarket-shelves-idUSKBN2121AN?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shifting priorities</a> in order to keep stores stocked with essential items. They'll stop making nice-but-not-necessary goods, like scented bleach, and crank out the highest-priority items, like food staples.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Google and the U.S. government </strong>are launching a <a href="https://www.blog.google/inside-google/company-announcements/covid-19-how-were-continuing-to-help/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">website</a> today dedicated to providing the public with COVID-19 resources. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The Financial Services Forum, </strong>which includes the biggest banks in the U.S. like JPMorgan and Citigroup, said its members would <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/big-u-banks-halt-stock-231521203.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">halt stock buybacks</a> through Q2 to provide more capital to customers affected by COVID-19.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The road ahead</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><span>Millions of healthcare workers, volunteers, and service workers are on the front lines caring for affected populations. </span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The government is also calling on us, everyday citizens, to make extraordinary sacrifices. The CDC has recommended we <a href="https://www.axios.com/cdc-coronavirus-cancel-large-gatherings-a157a76c-9b3c-41d0-be63-43caa917adaa.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hold off</a> on gathering in groups of 50 or more people for the next eight weeks. That means no music festivals, no weddings, no trivia nights, no Morning Brew happy hours.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It's hard to imagine what the next few months will be like. But what's comforting is knowing that in this battle, we're all fighting on the same side. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/15/seattlearea-businesses-hint-coronavirus-impacts-come-us?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
COVID-19 Case No. 1: Seattle
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Riding passed a closed movie theater in Seattle " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTYvY2xvc2VkX2Rvd25faW5fc2VhdHRsZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>John Moore/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With nearly 650 cases, Washington State—particularly Seattle's King County—is at the center of the U.S.' COVID-19 outbreak. The situation there may give us a better idea of what to expect in other cities.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Seattle's brick-and-mortar establishments are as empty as a Chick-fil-A on Sunday. OpenTable reservations were down 63% annually on Saturday. Fine-dining establishments have turned into drive-thrus.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Seattle’s restaurant scene is closely linked to Amazon's workforce. But Amazon employees have been WFH since March 5, and restaurants have seen their corporate dining businesses </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/16544868-660b-11ea-800d-da70cff6e4d3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">evaporate</a></span><span>, the FT reports. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At the city level, Seattle's <a href="https://www.seattletimes.com/seattle-news/seattle-to-offer-grants-of-up-to-10k-to-small-businesses-impacted-by-novel-coronavirus-outbreak/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">providing</a> $1.5 million in grants to small businesses (prioritizing those that are immigrant, refugee, and minority-owned). Washington State <a href="https://www.seattletimes.com/business/local-business/seattle-area-businesses-fear-that-government-relief-wont-make-up-for-drop-in-sales-due-to-coronavirus/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expanded</a> unemployment insurance availability, provided extensions for business tax payments, and organized resources for businesses to secure financial aid. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Loans help, but they <a href="https://www.seattletimes.com/business/local-business/seattle-area-businesses-fear-that-government-relief-wont-make-up-for-drop-in-sales-due-to-coronavirus/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">can’t replace</a> the thrill of catching a salmon at Pike Place Market. The state could have 25,000 cases by early April if dramatic measures aren't taken, and in the case of a prolonged downturn, businesses may face more layoffs, wage cuts, or shutdowns.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/15/governments-around-world-responding-coronavirus?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Coronavirus Around the Globe
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="coronavirus image" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMDYvY29yb25hdmlydXNfaW1hZ2UuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The "epicenter" of the pandemic has now shifted to Europe, the WHO said Friday. Here's the latest across the globe...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">U.S.: </strong>With new travel restrictions in place, some airports were <a href="https://apnews.com/1510caddee80ea2d73363fab76d55967?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">overwhelmed</a> with returning passengers Saturday night, leading to hours-long lines and lots of social undistancing. The Dept. of Homeland Security has limited inbound flights from restricted countries to 13 airports.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Spain: </strong>The government said people should <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-51892477?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">not leave home</a> outside of going to work or buying essential items. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">France: </strong>All "non-essential" stores, such as restaurants and cafes, were <a href="https://www.france24.com/en/diaporama/20200315-in-pictures-france-goes-into-lockdown-as-caf%C3%A9s-bars-and-all-non-essential-business-ordered-to-close?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ordered to close</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Italy: </strong>One writer compared the <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/mar/15/life-lockdown-parma-italy-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hushed atmosphere in the north</a> to a post-apocalyptic film. Yesterday, the country reported its largest one-day death count from the virus.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The U.K.: </strong>Prime Minister Boris Johnson has been <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-15/u-k-not-trying-to-contain-coronavirus-singapore-minister-says?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">criticized</a> for implementing lighter restrictions than his European peers. The country's health secretary defended the approach, but cases rose 43% on Saturday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">China: </strong>The country, which has suffered more than 3,200 deaths from COVID-19, recently reported only <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2020/03/15/fauci-coronavirus-china-korea-130027?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">11 new cases</a>, per Dr. Anthony Fauci, the U.S.' top infectious disease expert.</p>

</td>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/15/reddit-cofounder-buys-ad-telling-people-stay-home?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Big Billboard Outside Times Square, New York
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A billboard in Times Square telling people to stay at home" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTEvdGltZXNfc3F1YXJlX2NvdmlkLTE5X2JpbGxib2FyZC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>AdQuick</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Saturday, Reddit cofounder Alexis Ohanian bought a huge ad in Times Square telling people to avoid Times Square and stay home. As if we haven't already been doing that for years...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"It was a deliberate approach to think what is one of the densest populations of people in the U.S. and on a normal day that would be Times Square,” </span><span><a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/martyswant/2020/03/14/reddit-co-founder-alexis-ohanian-bought-a-billboard-in-time-square-to-inform-people-about-covid-19/#458a19e03a13?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">he told Forbes</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At the bottom of the billboard is the hashtag <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2020/03/13/815502262/flattening-a-pandemics-curve-why-staying-home-now-can-save-lives?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">#FlattenTheCurve</a>. The “curve” shows that healthcare systems can get overwhelmed quickly if everyone gets sick all at once. The more people practice social distancing measures like, say, avoiding Times Square at all costs, the more manageable the caseload becomes in the long run.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Appearing on <em>all five </em>Sunday morning talk shows, Dr. Anthony Fauci <a href="https://www.axios.com/fauci-coronavirus-overreaction-decc88f5-ab25-4c27-86d2-aff3acea583c.html?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=organic&utm_content=1100&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stressed</a> just how much everyone needs to stay away from each other. Yes, even us millennial-folk, who can still get sick or be a vector/carrier of the disease. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><span>"I think Americans should be prepared that they are going to have to hunker down significantly more than we as a country are doing," he said.</span></span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">+ The WaPo has more on how you <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2020/world/corona-simulator/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">flatten the curve</a>.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The idea of a <strong style="color:#000">flexible, beautiful workplace</strong> <strong style="color:#000">where I could really focus—and with amenities that go far beyond free coffee—</strong>was the stuff of fantasy. </p>

From the multi-sized conference rooms and soundproof phone booths to the collaborative lounges and private wellness rooms, Industrious’s spaces are designed to boost productivity in ways I never thought possible.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Truly, Industrious has thought about everything. Members can even change their move-in dates as needed on a month-to-month basis. <strong style="color:#000">They can also redeem a free day of workspace at any time that works for them.</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With more than 95 locations in 50+ cities, <a href="https://www.industriousoffice.com/morning-brew?utm_source=localmediabuy&utm_medium=regional_marketing&utm_campaign=morningbrew&utm_content=gif" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Industrious</a> has helped companies like Spotify, Compass, and Pivotal scale their operations without skipping a beat. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Leave the motivational posters behind and <a href="https://www.industriousoffice.com/morning-brew?utm_source=localmediabuy&utm_medium=regional_marketing&utm_campaign=morningbrew&utm_content=gif" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">schedule your visit today</a>.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/15/nfl-players-vote-approve-collective-bargaining-agreement-2030?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
NFL Players, Owners Reach Peace Accord
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="NFL" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=670 src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/215/kansas_city.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="NFL" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/215/kansas_city.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When sports come back—and they <em>will </em>come back—football might look a little bit different. This weekend, NFL players voted to <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/sports/nfl/2020/03/15/nfl-cba-collective-bargaining-agreement-changes-details/4878786002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">approve</a> a new collective bargaining agreement with league owners that lasts through the 2030 season. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The headlines: </strong>The NFL can expand the regular season to 17 games as early as 2021. And <em>this </em>season, the playoff field could expand from 12 to 14 teams.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What's in it <a href="https://www.espn.com/nfl/story/_/id/28901832/nfl-cba-approved-players-get-new-deal-how-expanded-playoffs-schedule-work?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">for the players</a>? </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>They'll start to earn a higher share of league revenue. Players currently get 47%, which would bump up to at least 48% in 2021. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Minimum salaries will jump around 20%.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A general relaxation around marijuana testing policies, including eliminating suspensions for positive tests.  </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The deal sets the stage for what'll be <a href="https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/business/story/2020-03-05/why-the-next-tv-rights-deal-for-the-nfl-will-be-bigger-than-ever?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blockbuster negotiations</a> with media companies. Networks currently pay more than $5 billion collectively to air NFL games, which accounted for 41 of the 50 most-watched TV broadcasts last year. Most of the current deals last through 2022.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/15/week-ahead-march-16?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

The Strange Week Ahead

<img alt="Cherry blossoms in D.C." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTMvY2hlcnJ5X2Jsb3Nzb21zLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty Images</em></small>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Our routines may be a little out of whack, but at least the Earth still revolves around the Sun. This week, winter ends and spring begins. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Monday: </strong>Freedom of Information Day </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tuesday: </strong>Retail sales; St. Patrick’s Day (acceptable to drink alone?); presidential primaries (AZ, FL, IL, OH); FedEx earnings; second anniversary of the Cambridge Analytica scandal </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wednesday: </strong>Housing starts </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thursday: </strong>First day of spring; first round of NCAA tournament would’ve been played <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/apple/237/loudly-crying-face_1f62d.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Friday: </strong>Existing home sales; incredible timing for International Day of Happiness</p>

<tr>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WHAT ELSE IS BREWING
</h3>
</td>

</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/new-york-city-close-schools-bars-restaurants-around-u-s-n1159651?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New York City</a></span><span> closed its school system, the country's biggest, through Apr. 20.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/15/nyregion/new-york-coronavirus.html?action=click&module=Spotlight&pgtype=Homepage&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NYC restaurants</a></span><span> can only serve takeout and delivery, while bars that don't serve food must close. </span><span><a href="https://thehill.com/policy/healthcare/487684-illinois-ohio-closing-all-bars-restaurants-in-response-to-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ohio and Illinois</a></span><span> took more drastic measures.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/3/14/21179542/apple-closing-retail-stores-march-27-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple</a></span><span> is closing all retail locations outside of Greater China. </span>

SPONSORED BY CARIUMA

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Your clothes can help the world. </strong>Many of our readers are—rightly—concerned with the environment. And while people think about waste in terms of trash or recycling in terms of aluminum cans, we’re taking a different, more stylish approach. So we <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/11/save-world-look-good" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">put together an article with our pals at CARIUMA</a> to show you how to change your wardrobe and <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/11/save-world-look-good" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">help the world</a>.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BREW'S BETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Brew's Guide to Working From Home
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Things are about to get weird. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But, as virtually all generic motivational quotes remind us, it’s less about the adversity you face than how you respond.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With that in mind, we spent the weekend compiling everything you need to remain a functioning member of society while working from your living room. And by everything…we mean everything:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Tips on how to be productive when the TV is 10 feet away</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Our favorite books, podcasts, and articles once you turn off work for the evening</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Workouts, recipes, board games, music streams, and more</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/14rvaKj6icxKcKgkd-yNNQ_v4zgRPUxVUIJBVcr0kox0/edit?usp=sharing&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check out the guide</a>, then share with friends.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Business Is Not Usual
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Because calling into a meeting while wearing a bathrobe is new to a lot of us, we've been gathering WFH Horror Stories from readers in these unprecedented times. The latest entries:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><span>"I didn't have the heart to tell my boss that the entire team could see his bong sitting on the mantle."</span></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><span>"Zoom call with over half the company (100 people), the manager forgot he was sharing his screen, and he got a Slack message from another manager talking s*** about the CEO and how he loves to hear himself blabber on for hours."</span></span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><span>We're sure more delicious awkwardness will pile up over the days ahead. <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/paI0M3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Share your stories here</a>. </span></p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin said he’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-15/mnuchin-says-doesn-t-expect-u-s-recession-from-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot anticipating a recession\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, but “because of the things that we’re requesting to do, there are parts of the economy shutting down or slowing down dramatically.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMarkets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eStock futures \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/15/traders-await-futures-open-after-fed-cuts-rates-launches-easing-program.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplummeted\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to their \"limit down\" levels despite coordinated action from central banks around the world. Extreme volatility is going nowhere. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edebated\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e how to respond to the coronavirus pandemic, the chances of a recession, and their handwashing style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nECONOMY\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/15/weekend-world-declared-war-coronavirus?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nA World at War\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A sign telling people to stay at home\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMTkvc3RheV9hdF9ob21lX3BpYy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eDavid Ramos/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis weekend, the world declared war on the coronavirus. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Federal Reserve took drastic emergency action yesterday to stabilize the economy. It \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/cf1d8e5487eee5e9eb649f0c6700ded6?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecut interest rates\u003c/a\u003e by a full percentage point and said it would buy $700 billion in Treasuries and mortgage-backed securities. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBusinesses facing a sudden drop in customers need short-term loans to keep the lights on and pay employees. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\"All told, the Fed's aggressive actions are intended to keep financial markets functioning and lending flowing to businesses and consumers,\" the AP explains. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe private sector mobilizes \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDuring World War II, Chrysler and GM began making fuselages, airplane engines, and tanks. Today, companies are also ditching their day-to-day to serve the greater need.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLVMH, \u003c/strong\u003ethe French luxury group, is \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/15/lvmh-converts-perfume-facilities-france-disinfectant-production?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econverting\u003c/a\u003e facilities that typically produce cosmetics and perfumes for brands like Christian Dior to make disinfectant gel and prevent a shortage of hand sanitizer.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe U.K. \u003c/strong\u003eis \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/business-51896168?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etalking to \u003c/a\u003eRolls-Royce, manufacturer JCB, and other firms to help make ventilators. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eConsumer goods companies \u003c/strong\u003eare \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-retail-usa/factories-shift-operations-in-scramble-to-restock-supermarket-shelves-idUSKBN2121AN?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshifting priorities\u003c/a\u003e in order to keep stores stocked with essential items. They'll stop making nice-but-not-necessary goods, like scented bleach, and crank out the highest-priority items, like food staples.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGoogle and the U.S. government \u003c/strong\u003eare launching a \u003ca href=\"https://www.blog.google/inside-google/company-announcements/covid-19-how-were-continuing-to-help/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewebsite\u003c/a\u003e today dedicated to providing the public with COVID-19 resources. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe Financial Services Forum, \u003c/strong\u003ewhich includes the biggest banks in the U.S. like JPMorgan and Citigroup, said its members would \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/big-u-banks-halt-stock-231521203.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehalt stock buybacks\u003c/a\u003e through Q2 to provide more capital to customers affected by COVID-19.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe road ahead\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMillions of healthcare workers, volunteers, and service workers are on the front lines caring for affected populations. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe government is also calling on us, everyday citizens, to make extraordinary sacrifices. The CDC has recommended we \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/cdc-coronavirus-cancel-large-gatherings-a157a76c-9b3c-41d0-be63-43caa917adaa.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehold off\u003c/a\u003e on gathering in groups of 50 or more people for the next eight weeks. That means no music festivals, no weddings, no trivia nights, no Morning Brew happy hours.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt's hard to imagine what the next few months will be like. But what's comforting is knowing that in this battle, we're all fighting on the same side. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" Seattle\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Riding passed a closed movie theater in Seattle \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eJohn Moore/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith nearly 650 cases, Washington State—particularly Seattle's King County—is at the center of the U.S.' COVID-19 outbreak. The situation there may give us a better idea of what to expect in other cities.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSeattle's brick-and-mortar establishments are as empty as a Chick-fil-A on Sunday. OpenTable reservations were down 63% annually on Saturday. Fine-dining establishments have turned into drive-thrus.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSeattle’s restaurant scene is closely linked to Amazon's workforce. But Amazon employees have been WFH since March 5, and restaurants have seen their corporate dining businesses \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/16544868-660b-11ea-800d-da70cff6e4d3?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eevaporate\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, the FT reports. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt the city level, Seattle's \u003ca href=\"https://www.seattletimes.com/seattle-news/seattle-to-offer-grants-of-up-to-10k-to-small-businesses-impacted-by-novel-coronavirus-outbreak/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eproviding\u003c/a\u003e $1.5 million in grants to small businesses (prioritizing those that are immigrant, refugee, and minority-owned). Washington State \u003ca href=\"https://www.seattletimes.com/business/local-business/seattle-area-businesses-fear-that-government-relief-wont-make-up-for-drop-in-sales-due-to-coronavirus/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexpanded\u003c/a\u003e unemployment insurance availability, provided extensions for business tax payments, and organized resources for businesses to secure financial aid. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Loans help, but they \u003ca href=\"https://www.seattletimes.com/business/local-business/seattle-area-businesses-fear-that-government-relief-wont-make-up-for-drop-in-sales-due-to-coronavirus/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecan’t replace\u003c/a\u003e the thrill of catching a salmon at Pike Place Market. The state could have 25,000 cases by early April if dramatic measures aren't taken, and in the case of a prolonged downturn, businesses may face more layoffs, wage cuts, or shutdowns.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe \"epicenter\" of the pandemic has now shifted to Europe, the WHO said Friday. Here's the latest across the globe...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eU.S.: \u003c/strong\u003eWith new travel restrictions in place, some airports were \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/1510caddee80ea2d73363fab76d55967?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoverwhelmed\u003c/a\u003e with returning passengers Saturday night, leading to hours-long lines and lots of social undistancing. The Dept. of Homeland Security has limited inbound flights from restricted countries to 13 airports.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSpain: \u003c/strong\u003eThe government said people should \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-51892477?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enot leave home\u003c/a\u003e outside of going to work or buying essential items. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFrance: \u003c/strong\u003eAll \"non-essential\" stores, such as restaurants and cafes, were \u003ca href=\"https://www.france24.com/en/diaporama/20200315-in-pictures-france-goes-into-lockdown-as-caf%C3%A9s-bars-and-all-non-essential-business-ordered-to-close?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eordered to close\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eItaly: \u003c/strong\u003eOne writer compared the \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/mar/15/life-lockdown-parma-italy-coronavirus?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehushed atmosphere in the north\u003c/a\u003e to a post-apocalyptic film. Yesterday, the country reported its largest one-day death count from the virus.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe U.K.: \u003c/strong\u003ePrime Minister Boris Johnson has been \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-15/u-k-not-trying-to-contain-coronavirus-singapore-minister-says?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecriticized\u003c/a\u003e for implementing lighter restrictions than his European peers. The country's health secretary defended the approach, but cases rose 43% on Saturday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e11 new cases\u003c/a\u003e, per Dr. Anthony Fauci, the U.S.' top infectious disease expert.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Saturday, Reddit cofounder Alexis Ohanian bought a huge ad in Times Square telling people to avoid Times Square and stay home. As if we haven't already been doing that for years...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\"It was a deliberate approach to think what is one of the densest populations of people in the U.S. and on a normal day that would be Times Square,” \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/martyswant/2020/03/14/reddit-co-founder-alexis-ohanian-bought-a-billboard-in-time-square-to-inform-people-about-covid-19/#458a19e03a13?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehe told Forbes\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt the bottom of the billboard is the hashtag \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2020/03/13/815502262/flattening-a-pandemics-curve-why-staying-home-now-can-save-lives?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e#FlattenTheCurve\u003c/a\u003e. The “curve” shows that healthcare systems can get overwhelmed quickly if everyone gets sick all at once. The more people practice social distancing measures like, say, avoiding Times Square at all costs, the more manageable the caseload becomes in the long run.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAppearing on \u003cem\u003eall five \u003c/em\u003eSunday morning talk shows, Dr. Anthony Fauci \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/fauci-coronavirus-overreaction-decc88f5-ab25-4c27-86d2-aff3acea583c.html?utm_source=twitter\u0026utm_medium=social\u0026utm_campaign=organic\u0026utm_content=1100\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estressed\u003c/a\u003e just how much everyone needs to stay away from each other. Yes, even us millennial-folk, who can still get sick or be a vector/carrier of the disease. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\"I think Americans should be prepared that they are going to have to hunker down significantly more than we as a country are doing,\" he said.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e+ The WaPo has more on how you \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/graphics/2020/world/corona-simulator/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eflatten the curve\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMy first job out of college was in an office where motivational posters adorned the walls and my core responsibilities included restocking the store-brand cereal and avoiding conversation with Jerry. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe idea of a \u003cstrong href=\"https://www.industriousoffice.com/morning-brew?utm_source=localmediabuy\u0026utm_medium=regional_marketing\u0026utm_campaign=morningbrew\u0026utm_content=gif\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" Its move-in ready offices changed my entire perspective on what a workplace could be like. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen sports come back—and they \u003cem\u003ewill \u003c/em\u003ecome back—football might look a little bit different. This weekend, NFL players voted to \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/sports/nfl/2020/03/15/nfl-cba-collective-bargaining-agreement-changes-details/4878786002/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eapprove\u003c/a\u003e a new collective bargaining agreement with league owners that lasts through the 2030 season. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe headlines: \u003c/strong\u003eThe NFL can expand the regular season to 17 games as early as 2021. And \u003cem\u003ethis \u003c/em\u003eseason, the playoff field could expand from 12 to 14 teams.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat's in it \u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/nfl/story/_/id/28901832/nfl-cba-approved-players-get-new-deal-how-expanded-playoffs-schedule-work?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efor the players\u003c/a\u003e? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThey'll start to earn a higher share of league revenue. Players currently get 47%, which would bump up to at least 48% in 2021. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMinimum salaries will jump around 20%.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA general relaxation around marijuana testing policies, including eliminating suspensions for positive tests.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe deal sets the stage for what'll be \u003ca href=\"https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/business/story/2020-03-05/why-the-next-tv-rights-deal-for-the-nfl-will-be-bigger-than-ever?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblockbuster negotiations\u003c/a\u003e with media companies. Networks currently pay more than $5 billion collectively to air NFL games, which accounted for 41 of the 50 most-watched TV broadcasts last year.
